content:
Posted: July 16, 2012
												One of the best action MMORPG I've ever played. The combat mechanics are simple to grasp and yet difficult difficult to master. It truly takes skills to be one of the top players. While dungeon crawling gets tedious due to the large amount of weak mobs, it's the boss where all the fun is at. Every boss is unique in some way, and while the most skilled can solo, it is highly recommended to fight in a party. You think the regular bosses are too easy still? There are raid bosses where they are extremely unique and dangerous requiring parties of 8 (some even 24)!Since I am a fickle player when it comes to real money purchases, I am glad to say like League of Legends (yes, I sometimes play that...), real world money purchases do not extend any further than character "skins", inner armour, more inventory space, etc etc. Overall, Vindictus is one of the best, most rewarding, adrenaline pumping games I've ever played.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												A great game marred by server problems and terrible customer support. The combat is, for the most part, fast and fluid. The different characters offer an excellent spread of combat styles, and each character has two different weapons available which radically change the way you can play with a character. The game has excellent customization options through armor and weapons, enchant scrolls and armor enhancement.Slightly offsetting the game is an economy that is somewhat out of balance due to rampant inflation, a heavy emphasis on pay to win philosophies at the end-game, server problems and abysmal customer support. Bans happen arbitrarily, with no explanation or recourse for those affected. The game primarily revolves around player hosted 4-6 person instances, with larger raids being server hosted groups of 6-25 players. The quality of the host's connection greatly affects the playability of regular instances, and server lag is frequently a source of disruption in raids.Having played the game off and on for nearly three years, it's still a solid hack and slash game, well worth playing but perhaps not worth sinking the fortune (or incredible time investment) it would take to be competitive with the established end-game crowd.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												This is so far the only MMO RPG I can actually stomach because it has a combat system based around actually moving and attacking instead of standing still and hammering keys until you or your enemy drops.It's also radically different from other MMOs in that you go to dungeons usually with only four-person parties. There is no loot or XP theft, XP for every enemy killed is given to all players and everyone gets their own items. Raids boost the cap to 6 or 8 players, but some can be either easy enough to do alone at higher levels or ludicrously difficult even with a full crew. Enemy balance swings wildly between easy and punishingly hard. But at least you never feel like you only lost because you didn't have the right stats - only the hardest raid bosses at the very late part of the game require heavy stat-boosting to break their defense.But it's a Korean game which means lots, and lots, and LOOOOOOOTS of grinding. And the U.S. distributor of the game Nexon is a notoriously poor company, slow to respond to almost every customer support request and always lagging far behind the other releases of the game's updates here in North America. Europe though has a much more competent staff looking after them, lucky them.There is a pay-for-power system of sorts in place in that you pay for items that prevent damage to your equipment when enhancing them. Considering how long it takes to collect as many rare items to make the more powerful gear this was obviously a conscious design decision – it's estimated that the drop rate of the rarest items for making top-tier equipment is below 1%. Needless to say this has led to an in-game economy that is completely broken. Offers for rare items topping 10 million in-game currency are common.But somehow I still keep coming back to this game simply because it's such a well-made combat system that no one who's ever made a MMO RPG has ever apparently even thought to try except Terra. Which I can't stomach for other reasons.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												Vindictus is a fun, entertaining hack & slash with memorable bosses and great gameplay. Unfortunately the game falls a bit short in its story, leveling, and high level community.Without spoiling anything, the story is extremely cheesy with unlikable characters who you just grow to hate. There aren't any redeeming qualities about the characters even when the developers try to force it upon you.The leveling gets very grindy really quick, unless you are willing to invest a few dollars into VIP services or you manage to happen upon one from a level up gift / special event.The high level community are pretty toxic, to the point that they won't even consider you if you don't have specific stats for your chosen character. If you didn't place your stats rights you are out of luck unless you are willing to invest some money into AP resets.Other than those fallbacks, the gameplay is still entertaining, addicting and worth the playtime.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												This has got to be one of, if not the best MMO I have ever played. I love how Nexon added as much individualization to their character creation as they did. The only way they could really add to it would be making characters be either gender. I'm not sure where people are getting the Pay to Win style from because with the number of free cash shop items Nexon had given out, I got to level 60 without spending a dime. after that, I only bought cosmetic stuff(inner armor, tattoos, etc) until I hit about lever 65 at which point I bought 1 enhancement rune to try to get a weapon to +10(turned out I didn't need it, so I used it for another weapon).I think the community on this game(or at least 99% of it) is very pleasant. Sure you get trolls and irritating people, but find me any multiplayer game that doesn't have that. I thoroughly enjoy the raids offered, and the graphics definitely don't hurt that. That being said, the lag on here is slightly less than perfect, but that's forgiveable with the graphics and all the other stuff going on. Past the character and skills, the customization is nearly limitless. there are hundreds of armor sets and when combined, leave you with thousands, maybe millions, of combinations to give your character the look you want.If you're on the fence about trying this game, do yourself a favor and go for it. The beginning is a little slow, but that's the way all games are... you have to have time to learn the combat system and all the other stuff before you can take down a dragon with it, after all. On the note of combat system and controls, you can choose between keyboard, mouse, or gamepad(works with PS3/XBOX360 or later controllers) modes. Once you select the one you like most, you can fine-tune it to your ideal setup. My ratings for this game are...Community: 4.75/5Graphics:4-5/5(based on graphics settings, but even lowest are still quite wonderful)Connection:3.75-5/5(depending on host and your individual settings along with device capabilities)Story/Plot: 5/5Character Customization/Skills: 4.75/5Ease of use(to get started): 5/5(starts slow, but you learn all the in's and out's of the game)Overall rating:4.5-4.9/5

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												I'm redoing this review because of yeah, I'm pretty sure Nexon got up off their arses and did something.Everything about this game is near perfect. In order to make an income, you need to collect items and sell them to other players. That leaves you with your own thoughts on, "If I set this much based on the original value, will someone buy it in the amount of time it is up?" I have sold several things in few seconds of posting them, due to the rarity item and the cost based on the maximum and minimum. Now that leaves a problem, getting money to do so in the first place, as it DOES take a fee to sell. Farm, or if you can, get a friend to donate money to you. [Option two is limited to those who were led to this game by a friend, or who have a friend who already has a large sum of in-game currency.] And to those complaining about Nexon making you pay for things, they make you pay for cosmetics. They are not needed for the main story, nor are they needed for 90% of the sub-stories. Stop complaining about it, as it is a simple want for the items you are being asked to pay for. Fighting is great, perfect. It is easy at the start but as you get higher and higher into the battle sequences, you find it challenging and you have to work as a team. The community is great, nobody complains from what I've seen, and when it comes to teamwork everyone is top-notch. The graphics are great, but of course that does depend on the strength of your graphics card/computer. I have to set mine to low, but at medium they are what I would say "High" for a F2P game. If I were to call this game anything, it would be "Battle Simulation". Nexon made this game to focus on breaking the limitations of battle in most MMORPGs, and they did. There is no wait time for skills, well, of course for the ones that do really high damage. But combo's are based on you, added to your timing and precision to dodge and attack enemies while taking little damage as possible is also up to you. The trade could use a few touch ups, along with gold. But mainly, this game is near perfect, and I would reccomend this to anyone.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												It'd be a good game if it wasn't an mmo. That being said, it's free so you might as well try it out. Getting through the main storyline won't require any $$$ from you.A lot of the negative things about Vindictus stem from the fact that it's an MMO, because most of the MMO aspects of it aren't great. Such as gearing up, which is a nightmare. Grindfest AND a chance based system? It's a little much and most players won't even bother, leaving those who do feeling superior to the rest of the population. It's a lot more enjoyable when you're with friends who don't judge you based on how much $$$ you spent. That being said, you don't really need good gear to have fun. It's a skill based game, gear is simply there to subsidize a lack of skill. I've seen people solo 8-man lv 60 & 70 (end game) content naked. This fact is the main reason I'm recommending it. That and it's free so even if you don't like it, who cares? Uninstall it and no harm is done. As a side note: some bosses discourage players who stack gear. For an example, arguablly one of the hardest bosses about a year ago, Keaghan, has an attack cap of 13.8k. So all the 20k att the wallet-warriors get screwed. A lot of the newer bosses encourage teamwork over DPS, like Bark No.1. Also, an upcoming boss, the succubus queen, has attacks that ignore defense completely in addition to being unable to revive in any way (even goddess graces, the paid method).The storyline is probably the best I've seen out of a F2P mmo.. ever. They really give all their NPCs a personality and if they die (which some do) you actually feel something. It's too bad the voice acting is terrible, but the way you get quest dialogue 90% of the time is reminiscent of graphic novel games. The graphics are of course outstanding, I don't think screen-shots really do the game justice. You can see your characters breath. If you're in a cold environment you see mist form around their mouth between each breath. If you run out of stamina they get a tired animation. Everything is very fluid and seems natural up until the source engine's clipping issue. If that doesn't bother you than you'll be hard pressed going back to the AAA mmo's with comparatively terrible graphics.I see a lot of reviewers don't mention it, but the soundtrack is absolutely outstanding. It becomes especially apparent in raids. The music really enhances the whole game and I strongly encourage any prospective players to check some of it out on youtube.As for events, the majoritoy of them are quiet silly and some of them really give you some valuable items which you'd normally have to pay a lot of money for. An example of a silly one, is they had a valve cross-over event with TF2 and portal characters making appearances. Which introduced funny titles like "pwn'd by GLaDoS" and ..interesting hats like the headcrab. A recent even gave out +10 coupons for free, simply for being logged on.All in all, if you can get past the mmo nasty-ness and nexons continuous attempts to get money out of you, it really is a great game.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												Vindictus is a fun, entertaining hack & slash with memorable bosses and great gameplay. Unfortunately the game falls a bit short in its story, leveling, and high level community.Without spoiling anything, the story is extremely cheesy with unlikable characters who you just grow to hate. There aren't any redeeming qualities about the characters even when the developers try to force it upon you.The leveling gets very grindy really quick, unless you are willing to invest a few dollars into VIP services or you manage to happen upon one from a level up gift / special event.The high level community are pretty toxic, to the point that they won't even consider you if you don't have specific stats for your chosen character. If you didn't place your stats rights you are out of luck unless you are willing to invest some money into AP resets.Other than those fallbacks, the gameplay is still entertaining, addicting and worth the playtime.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												This has got to be one of, if not the best MMO I have ever played. I love how Nexon added as much individualization to their character creation as they did. The only way they could really add to it would be making characters be either gender. I'm not sure where people are getting the Pay to Win style from because with the number of free cash shop items Nexon had given out, I got to level 60 without spending a dime. after that, I only bought cosmetic stuff(inner armor, tattoos, etc) until I hit about lever 65 at which point I bought 1 enhancement rune to try to get a weapon to +10(turned out I didn't need it, so I used it for another weapon).I think the community on this game(or at least 99% of it) is very pleasant. Sure you get trolls and irritating people, but find me any multiplayer game that doesn't have that. I thoroughly enjoy the raids offered, and the graphics definitely don't hurt that. That being said, the lag on here is slightly less than perfect, but that's forgiveable with the graphics and all the other stuff going on. Past the character and skills, the customization is nearly limitless. there are hundreds of armor sets and when combined, leave you with thousands, maybe millions, of combinations to give your character the look you want.If you're on the fence about trying this game, do yourself a favor and go for it. The beginning is a little slow, but that's the way all games are... you have to have time to learn the combat system and all the other stuff before you can take down a dragon with it, after all. On the note of combat system and controls, you can choose between keyboard, mouse, or gamepad(works with PS3/XBOX360 or later controllers) modes. Once you select the one you like most, you can fine-tune it to your ideal setup. My ratings for this game are...Community: 4.75/5Graphics:4-5/5(based on graphics settings, but even lowest are still quite wonderful)Connection:3.75-5/5(depending on host and your individual settings along with device capabilities)Story/Plot: 5/5Character Customization/Skills: 4.75/5Ease of use(to get started): 5/5(starts slow, but you learn all the in's and out's of the game)Overall rating:4.5-4.9/5

content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												When I picked up this game about a year ago I thought it was neat, I hadn't reached much hours before this review, but anyways if you decide to pick up the game this might be helpful in some way. Basically, I started the missions in the game, I was instantly grasped by the games combat, you literally break backs and can send the body flying to another enemy. The graphics are neat, but I didn't care about the story as long as I went to hacknslash my way through hordes of enemies, which was probably the high point for me. I also picked up a buddy along the way. He was around my level, and we stuck together for multiple levels, together we did missions until my computer broke because of a hard drive problem, and since it is an old computer I decided to buy a new windows computer. Ever since then I have never seen my buddy. Im sure most of you have experienced this in co-op games, you find someone that you start sticking around with and then just like that you never see him again. When I picked up this game I thought it was probably better than all those other free RPG's out there, so why not just play this? Im sure all those people saying its P2W are just too lazy to do the work they need to do to get what they want without paying, and trust me, as I have played multiple games that have a slow learning curve, if you don't P2W and get it like it was meant to be it will feel like you truly accomplished something, and you can go up to people and tell them that you are legit if you want, I bet they will feel more confident about reaching that goal you just set for them if they are a lower level than you, if its a higher level than you they probably won't care or will feel happy for you.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												One of the best combat systems even in today's gaming frontier. However, it's a VERY rough diamond in the middle of smoother prettier diamonds.  A diamond because the combat, graphics despite it's age, and the lore it has. Rough because of how unforgiving the RNG is in this game when you're attempting to min/max your character stats. Failures on high level weapon/armor enchanting/enchancing will lead to the destruction of said gear. RNG for material drops are no less rewarding. This is mainly due to being a korean made game where RNG is a large aspect in many games made in the country. Despite the RNG I still find myself logging back on to play. Feel free to give this a try, but be warned.I've played this game for roughly 4 years, but had to switch to launching via steam because the new nexon launcher is filled with problems and  nexon seeming just tried to shove it down the throats of players.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2012
												Imagine a giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥flying towards your mouth, and there's nothing you can do about it. And you're like "Oh man, I'm gonna have to suck this thing", and you brace yourself to suck this giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ But then, at the last moment, it changes trajectory and hits you in the eye. You think to yourself "Well, at least I got that out of the way", but then the giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥rears back and stabs your eye again, and again, and again. Eventually, this giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥is penetrating your gray matter, and you begin to lose control of your motor skills. That's when the giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥slaps you across the cheek, causing you to fall out of your chair. Unable to move and at your most vulnerable, the giant♥♥♥♥♥♥♥finally lodges itself in your♥♥♥♥♥♥ where it rests uncomfortably for 4, maybe 5 hours. That's what playing Vindictus is like.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												Nexon finally did something right. Vindictus is amazing in almost every sence of the word, featuring high intesnity battles and increasingly difficult yet fun boss raids, what's not to love? The first half of the game is very much a solo experience, as the battles and bosses are well balanced and simple to defeat. However, as you approach higher levels you are forced to work with others to take down the threats, allowing for an incredibly fun co-op experience. Character and class progression is good as the player chooses how to to level their skills, not the game. My only criticism is that co-op has no servers, save for major raid bosses. So if you want to co-op a normal battle quest you're relying on a p2p conection, which can be a huge problem for people playing with friends interstate.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												Vindictus is an action MMO from Nexon, and the prequel to the very popular MMO Mabinogi.Vindictus offers balls to the walls fast paced and intense action combat, where a split second can literally mean life or death mid game. Unlike most MMO's Vindictus actually offers a strong and interesting story line, however the story falls short and out of a lot of people’s interest due to the lack of voice acting throughout most of the game.And though Combat is fun after you beat the current story arc, there is little to do but grind leaving the game repetitive.The voice acting at the beginning of the game is beautifully done and executed however for some reason, the quality of the acting falls during the latter half of the first arc.All and all Vindictus is a beautiful action game however it is one you may find boring after a while, none the less it is still worth a play.Score 7/10

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												Did not take me long to remember why I walked on this game pre Steam release. While the combat mechanics are fun, the shelling out of money for cosmetics, hair style/color for one, is just plain ridiculous, then there is the wash, rinse, repeat grinding of the same fragging maps for level upon level...the game is a money grab and nothing more at this point, especially with some of the "updates" which has just ground down the choices of character customization even further and...yeah, just do not play unless you are one of those sorts with money to burn just to do even the most basic things that most other free to plays aren't so restrictive on...I mean come on...Pay for hairstyle/color!?!? That is just a new low in the online gaming market to add to my experiences I'd just as soon forget.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												NOT NEW PLAYER FRIENDLY!!! connection constantly drops in this mmo!!! I have a great expensive computer just for playing these kinds of games, but it doesn't really matter in vindictus. You can have a 3,000 dollar comp & still lag from other players no matter what. oh & CRASH a LOT!! for no reason!!!I would say recommend if it was a newer game but the fact that these problems still exist in such an old mmo is just trouble. There are still such little things that could have been fixed 100000000 years ago, like the loot bouncing all over the screen & out of the map & into the ceilings.... that is just ridiculous!! the fact that you can't grab your loot after the report screen pops up so you miss everything...They introduce you to the cash shops after like the 5th mission & they give you this default under armor that is - lets be honest- terrible looking with a lot of gear, so it makes you want to buy new under armor. it sucks!!! sure they let you pick a free hairstyle but only for 7 days. you even have to buy your face setup!! so unless you want to look like an asian teenager you have to spend some money on a new face/makeup.I give this game like a 5/10 for now but it could use some work that won't be done. im guessing ever. Go play Warframe, it's a much better free to play.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												Before I begin, I advise that if you're an Aussie to not even bother with joining the Australian server, it's dead, the economy is dead, nobody plays and the only people that do play are afk people (so I guess they're not really playing, lmao). Instead, hop straight on to US West server, good connection, lots of people and their market is booming.Pros- Outstanding story line- Plenty of different armours to aquire - Same with weapons- Bosses / Raids- Each boss has a different attack pattern, keeping you on your toes.- Always this feeling of "What's next?" - Combat is FLAWLESS- Not really heavy on your connection because when you start a dungeon, it runs off of your connection (you're the host) so if you have good internet you'll never lag, besides joining other peoples partys where the host has a bad connection (not the game's fault though)Cons- Have to pay for more storage space- No bank (besides guild storage and you have to pay 300k to make a guild)- Combat skills can be confusing, I feel as how they explained the skills is pretty confusing (you will get the hang of it eventually though, just a pain to start out with)- Leveling things such as tailoring, armoursmithing etc can be pretty grindy, even for someone like me who absolutely lives for the grind.- Not exactly beginner friendly, not too many tutorials and stuff in game to help the new players (but, you will get a hang of it eventually if you just stick with it).All in all, this game is very enjoyable 8/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4
												First of all, IGNORE my steam hours, i have played the official client before the Europe launch as the global client and steam version wasnt there at that time.Vindictus was the best hack-n-slash game i was able to play without being bored of grinding, even if you dont get gold or anything but items such as quest items and mob drops needed later on or needed to sell for $, it kept me ingame for a good time everyday and the fight style was better than the Tab-Target system one.I will be reviewing this game possitive because i found only some scratches back then and some new ones now(cons section below) and i actually recommend you give it a shot, at least 1 hour of gameplay(depending of the class you chose) the game can keep you in the community or not.*PROS*-Great graphics with great fighting system.~Dungeon system that is a bit different everytime so you wont get bored of the enviroment.~Good-ish FREE TO WIN item system: By free to win i mean that, if you want to win pvp or fights easyer, you dont need to invest huge amount of money into it, just time and grind, a lot in some cases, but it will be worth, you can get by luck and some gold spent the same items as a *Noob* spends real $ for it. AGAIN, all depending on the grind and luck youve got for enchanting and crafting.~HUGE time invested in boobs details and physics.*CONS*~Removed Jump? Why, i mean, why the hell would you remove the ability to jump-smash spiders and other mobs and look cool while you would do it? (tested on Evie and Fiona, Maybe on other classes works, idk YET)~Sometimes the mobs wont react to the dodge effect so they will still hit you(stupid thing if you ask me)~LOCKED 30FPS LIMIT? I mean, comon, i know my pc aint a beast but hell, at least let me unlock that limit so i can enjoy the game sometimes..~Party System sucks as if you create a party sometimes your friend wont be able to join saying that either one of you is offline to the other.~Space-smashing to skip the conversations... Yeah, if youre not in the story and you only want to play the game, you will smash the keys so you get to the action, a lot of people will react to this as its not an aspect of the game so imporant.. it is.This is all the stuff i can think right now but i can confirm that the game is fun until you get mad and rage quit :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12
												This is not your typical free to play MMORPG. Vindictus has a lot of things going for it; semi decent graphics, interesting character classes, boob physics, creative enemy and armor designs, boob physics... But where this game really shines is it's boss fights, particularly the multiplayer raids. The boss designs get more and more creative as you move along, with enough variation in each battle to keep you coming back for more. Having other players fight alongside you really provides a sense of camaraderie rarely seen in multiplayer games these days, especially in free to play games. This game is not perfect, the story is boring, the characters are flat, the menus are needlessly complicated, and some of the reuse of stages gets particularly annoying, but I find myself coming back for the creative boss designs and action-packed multiplayer raids, as they're just that fun.

Yeah, if youre not in the story and you only want to play the game, you will smash the keys so you get to the action, a lot of people will react to this as its not an aspect of the game so imporant.. it is.This is all the stuff i can think right now but i can confirm that the game is fun until you get mad and rage quit :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12
												This is not your typical free to play MMORPG. Vindictus has a lot of things going for it; semi decent graphics, interesting character classes, boob physics, creative enemy and armor designs, boob physics... But where this game really shines is it's boss fights, particularly the multiplayer raids. The boss designs get more and more creative as you move along, with enough variation in each battle to keep you coming back for more. Having other players fight alongside you really provides a sense of camaraderie rarely seen in multiplayer games these days, especially in free to play games. This game is not perfect, the story is boring, the characters are flat, the menus are needlessly complicated, and some of the reuse of stages gets particularly annoying, but I find myself coming back for the creative boss designs and action-packed multiplayer raids, as they're just that fun.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2012
												This game, has been a wild rollercoaster, this game used to be very bad on events and everything, like very awful. They've gotten a new director for Nexon's Vindictus NA branch and they brought last month a great event full of free items and free NX items as well. If any review has "EU" or "European" in it, don't bother reading it if you're planning to play NA because that stuff really won't apply to you.Without further ado, let us begin this review.+It has an original combat system for an MMO and doesn't really rely on skills being used 24/7 for most classes.+The graphics aren't that bad for it being a Source SDK Base 2007 game.+Controls are easily customizable for if you have a gamepad, mouse and keyboard, or a controller.+Events have gotten better now, so expect in the future better stuff from events unlike previously.+If you know the term Fashion Souls; that applies to this game as all of your gear can be fused to look like another set and be dyed to look certain colours with the dye ampoule system.-Has a terrible anti-cheat system, people have been banned for false positives of "third party programs" when it was just another game that they probably had running.+Every character has a role in the game, and is unique and different from one another.+Customization of how your character looks, hairstyles, how tall they are, how much muscle or fat they have; their makeup if they're female; tattoos, hairs, and inner armours(No stats added) [There will be another point on this below in the cons]+Uses market place transactions where the prices are always fluxuating; something one day could be expensive, and in a few days it could go down in price etc.+Bots don't really exist on the NA West servers from what I can tell, dunno about other servers.-Peer to peer connection system, so you have to gamble that you'll have good connection with the player hosting the raid/party.-Pay to progress, there is a lot of stuff that can help you skip the grind, but the only thing you can't skip is the level grind.-The RNG in Vindictus is horrid and painfully bad when it comes to enhancing weapons and enchanting gear as well [Take note of the con above, as you can skip most of the RNG with items from the cash shop.]-Updates are few and far between because the game is made by a Korean company, so the rest of the world gets content that is released in Korea about a few months later.-Cosmetics such as hairs, make ups, inner armours, tattoos, beards, and anything like that are cash shop items and cost money, or you can basically earn them by getting enough gold and buy airtight coupons off the marketplace-Marketplace prices can be skewed and have a cash shop item that puts your item at the top of the list as well, doesn't cost you anything to put up on the market.I give this game an 7.5/10; it's a well done game with some glaring issues, like the content updates being far and few between because it's a game made in Korea. But, overall, this game is worth giving a try.

												One of the most unique MMORPGs out there: the fighting mechanics are fluid and fun (action based, not ability based), the boss fights are glorious (one mistake can result in incapacitation in some instances: gotta dodge/block or you're toast), and the community seems pretty friendly. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												Haven't played for a while, but still felt the need to write my opinions. Anyways decent game, graphics focus on character models more than that of terrain, and the early levels are a slow grind of repetitive missions until you've spent some decent hours into the game. Once you pass the early stages of the game you reach levels that are more interactive and interesting than that earlier on. Just know before playing that you will look ugly if you don't spend time/money attempting to secure a decent outfit, and that time is required to reach the better levels, but it is worth it if you're into these types of games. Lastly I commend this game for being different from that of most mmo-rpgs seeing how levels are stages, rather than an open world environment, yet still manages to create skill based battles, requiring timing and decent equipment grinding. If you're new your best bet is to ask a high level player to help you and teach you the ropes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												There are a lot of MMO's out there each with their own benefits and downsides, some good and some bad, but if you were to ask me about Vindictus, I'd probably say it's good... Really good.PROS:- The game has really good combat, you don't just press a button and then the attack happens, you actually have combos you need to do. (There are active abilities were you press a button and the attack happens, but you have to aim it and sometimes have to follow it up with something else) Also attack animation look good and are fluent.- Some options on weapons for each class, not stuck with just 1 weapon type. (ex. Karok = Pillar/Cestus - Evie = Staff/Battle Scythe)- Interact with the environment, collect resources, breakable/grabbable items.- THE LORE/STORY, I believe the story and dialouge are AMAZING! It was one of the reason I still play the game. (Kinda rip season 2)- Very little pay2win/play feature that are immediatly apparent to the game ( Immediatly apparent pay2win/play feartures would be Something that will CHANGE the game, like not being able to go to a certain area or equip armor because you need to buy a subscription / ticket with real money)CONS:- Each class has a gender lock on it so if the class is a male, you're going to be a male character. (This is a problem for some people)- Some stages you have to repeat, which can get boring / make the story seem odd (Killing the same boss 2 or 3 times... He's already dead the first time right?- Combat can get repetitve when trying to defeat big bosses or when you are trying to farm.- There is some RNG on some max level gear. You might be trying to add or increase stats, this can result in adding or increasing a stat, or decreasing a stat which is a waste of time, gold, and it ruins your gear.PRO/CON MIX (Thing I'm unsure of)- If you spend money on the game, the RNG factor is not as big of a threat as it would be if you didn't spend money. The reason I do not put this as a con is because all it does it just make you're enchanting faster. You can do all of this without having to spend money, it just takes more time and you have to be commited to the game (Now if your gear gets destoryed thats a different problem...). What i'm saying is that the game IS [[[NOT PAY TO WIN/PAY]]] in my opinion, but rather it IS [[[PAY TO LOOK COOL/PAY TO DO STUFF FASTER]]].MY OPINION: The game is [[[NOT PAY TO WIN/PLAY]]] But rather it is [[[PAY TO LOOK COOL/PAY TO DO STUFF FASTER]]]OVERALL RATING: 8.5/10 DELICIOUS

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												When I picked up this game about a year ago I thought it was neat, I hadn't reached much hours before this review, but anyways if you decide to pick up the game this might be helpful in some way. Basically, I started the missions in the game, I was instantly grasped by the games combat, you literally break backs and can send the body flying to another enemy. The graphics are neat, but I didn't care about the story as long as I went to hacknslash my way through hordes of enemies, which was probably the high point for me. I also picked up a buddy along the way. He was around my level, and we stuck together for multiple levels, together we did missions until my computer broke because of a hard drive problem, and since it is an old computer I decided to buy a new windows computer. Ever since then I have never seen my buddy. Im sure most of you have experienced this in co-op games, you find someone that you start sticking around with and then just like that you never see him again. When I picked up this game I thought it was probably better than all those other free RPG's out there, so why not just play this? Im sure all those people saying its P2W are just too lazy to do the work they need to do to get what they want without paying, and trust me, as I have played multiple games that have a slow learning curve, if you don't P2W and get it like it was meant to be it will feel like you truly accomplished something, and you can go up to people and tell them that you are legit if you want, I bet they will feel more confident about reaching that goal you just set for them if they are a lower level than you, if its a higher level than you they probably won't care or will feel happy for you.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												One of the best combat systems even in today's gaming frontier. However, it's a VERY rough diamond in the middle of smoother prettier diamonds.  A diamond because the combat, graphics despite it's age, and the lore it has. Rough because of how unforgiving the RNG is in this game when you're attempting to min/max your character stats. Failures on high level weapon/armor enchanting/enchancing will lead to the destruction of said gear. RNG for material drops are no less rewarding. This is mainly due to being a korean made game where RNG is a large aspect in many games made in the country. Despite the RNG I still find myself logging back on to play. Feel free to give this a try, but be warned.I've played this game for roughly 4 years, but had to switch to launching via steam because the new nexon launcher is filled with problems and  nexon seeming just tried to shove it down the throats of players.

												I've been playing this game for years and with 500+ hours on it, here's my thoughts. Short and simple.I STILL think it's a great game. I don't see very many problems other than these:1: Gameplay gets extremely repetative. (Especially farming for ES to sell)2: Market is almost always fluctuating due to things either being overpriced or underpriced. (Mainly cash consumables, which isn't too big of a deal. Just me being a baby haha)3: Lack of community. There is almost no one on and rarely anyone to play with. Maybe I'm just unlucky? or maybe there's not a lot of people.That's basically all I can find to complain about since I started playing back in 2013.Rating: 7.5/10 PS- I personally think there should be a matchmaking setting as an option to find parties instead of "Quick Battle" and "Party Search". Again, that's just my opinion.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												to me, this game was a huge dissapointment. When I saw the ads to this game, it promised me that it would be filled with all kinds of boss fights and swarms of enemies, but all I got was four hours of enemys that could take two hits then die and couldn't even fight back. I saw this game as a heavly action bassed game. Fighting stiles are good but most of the story line is just annoying diolog that no one who saw the ad for this game would want to sit through. It takes more time to actually get into a story level than to beat it. What I recommend for the game is to have a little less diologe, toughen up the enemys a bit, and to make sure you could get the mojor boss battles quickly with out having to sit through all this pointless crap. The only reason I still play the game from time to time, is so I can do the major boss battles, without those, this game is nothing

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												The game's combat is pretty solid, it's combat in a game like this that you can't find any where else, Vindictus get combat right. Dodging, blocking, countering, ETC. The game has it's problems like every game does, but really, no game is ever perfect, there is always♥♥♥♥♥♥to fix, and things to keep updated. Other than that, the game is pretty fun, you won't find fun in a game like this any where else. You can customize your character, you can still make the character you choose stand out from everyone elses, if you choose to. If you are into cosmetics in a game like this, making your character stand out, you will have to pay for it, but it can be worth it in the end. There is basic character customization, but everything else you may have to pay for. In other words, the game gets FREE content from time to time, per say a new character, or area to explore and fight the bosses at the end of it and "Raids," and hopefully fixes to glitches, and optimization.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												Don't you dare. Do not click install. Don't. DOOOOON'T.This game. I know this game well. Like how well I know that ♥♥♥♥♥ down the street. Like with that strumpet, I wonder if I'm ploughing her or if she ploughs me. Judging by my super-AIDS i assumed the latter. This game will trick you into thinking it's really fun. Because it is. The combat is fantastic. I love it. But absolutely everything else about this game is God-awful. When you start out, it seems really fun. Then you get to the gear and stat grind. It's so bad. It's so damn bad. Nexon took a gem and tossed into a poop pile. 150 damn exquisite iron ores. Me and the other warlord of my clan decided to try out vindi again for the sick♥♥♥♥♥raid bosses, since warframe was being DDOSsed. We are towards the end game now, and holy crap FORGET exquisite iron ore. Most armor sets or weapons require an extraordinary amount of how high level ore. Iron comes from speckled turds in the instanced dungeons. One or two spawn. In season 2, u have a chance at getting lowest tier, second tier, third, or low chance at exquisite ores. Usually second tier drops. It requires 4 third tiers to craft exquisite.These sets require a total of 150 damn exquisite ores, among 20 count drops from raid bosses that are only dailies. Then their is the horrible enhance and enchant system. It's recommended to get a weapon to plus 8 to be any kind of viable. From +5-+8, the percent of success goes to 50%, to 40%. Failure resets rank to 0 and lowers durability, and takes the stones (more grind) you used. Buuut if u buy nexon cash, you can get runes that prevent those effects upon failure. No way to get nexon in game like Warframe btw. No discounts either. Enchants of a good rank only have 50% to 40% of success, but u can increase that by buying♥♥♥♥♥♥ Failure lowers durability and can break weapon for the good enchants. But guess what, u can buy a rune (nexon obviously) that saves your♥♥♥♥♥ Vindictus' gameplay is ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic, but the system built around it is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and promotes pay2win.At least you can get the parts for a frame in a day, at least formas and potatoes have NO failure chance, and at least you can get plat and resources BY PLAYING THE DAMN GAME.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Its very much a "Its alright.. could be better" kind of game.-Gameplay is decent, although it could be improved, many mechanics just feel thrown in as a gimmick rather than being actually useful. -The controls are janky and sometimes annoying. -The camera would be better if your characters attacks weren't locked to it, I've had few collision issues which is good.-Visually its quite generic, I've had quite a few frame drops during combat which gets annoying.-Customization is insanely limited. You can barely customize your character and considering that is something I love to do.. its definitely a point taker.-Interactions and general exploration is limited and weirdly done. It feels like its trying to be an action-RPG like warframe or Path of Exile but has a bunch of extra UI elements that really dont need to be there.-As for UI/HUD, its quite basic, only really annoying when "in buildings" or trying to access different areas.Generally it has some interesting ideas, the 3rd person action-RPG style is cool and I'd like to see it done more, however the game seems to fail to actually deliver it in a really engaging way. Whether its Nexons fault or lack of enough production time is unkown to me, whatever the case may be its definitely something to look at, however I wouldn't spend money on it.

Posted: February 20, 2015
												If you are interested in fast pace hack n slash mmo's this is the game for you. if you like high qualtiy graphics and insane boss fights this is the game for you. basically vindictus is a mmo hack n slash video game, yes there is skill to the game and takes practice with your character and the monsters to fight. the game has lag issues but you can look past it when u go to a low population channel on the server. it is a great game to play with friends, like if u download this tell your girlfriend and friends to download it too. i have to note this: this game requires you to use 85% of your mental power, meaning you have to read and pay attention to the NPC's or you will be lost. alot of people leave this game because. "they have no idea what to do, its too hard". when all you have to do is read. read! simple.

												God, I used to love this game. Me and all my friends would play it all the time. I had of the best memories playing through the dugeons and raids on this game. But slowly it just kept getting worse. I stopped playing for a while until Season 3 came out and holy♥♥♥♥♥♥season 3 was good. However, everytime this game took like a single step forward it took five steps backwards. Things that shouldn't be broken are, the devs don't care about the people that actually play the game, and most of all the people who play this game and care about it the most are getting banned. People who actually helped keep it alive. Now the only way NA Nexon gets people online is offering them free♥♥♥♥♥♥every other week. Sometimes I log back on the remember the fun times I had with this game. But with like 500 people online on average, you can tell this game is dead. Might as well merge East and West servers. Maybe people will come back

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												Best combat of an MMO I have every played, yet (I hope it won't be but it is fun). The main flaw of it's game combat is lack of complete manual aiming, there is a bit of auto-aiming for a number of abilities (they still can miss and sometimes auto-aiming mechanic makes them miss) and some lag and really, really minor issues with control/ui settings. The boss AI is very great, along with the combat. If you are an avid MMO player and want to see great combat mechanics, it's a must try and you can really challenge yourself if it's your goal. The level design of the game is fun and engaging along with the environments, though the scenerio and dungeons maps are very similar.It has great challenges and players can progress through this game the easy route AND they can challenge themselves when dungeons have normal, hard and hero modes and all. It's best to see this game as a co-op, and much better with friends I would assume, though extremely great and fun to solo as well. Also this game gets really "grindy" after levels 50. Leveling and progress becomes slower and more difficult but again if you have dedicated groups it might be more fun then. However, playing this game as a newcomer and about your first month of gameplay will be quite fun for sure if the combat style interests you.Negatives:The game's major design flaws in my mind are what I already mentioned about aiming. Not capitalizing on the jump feature as much (for balancing reason I assume, still good dodge/leap mechanics though) but major ones are. It's not an open world MMO,Expct to be limited to dungeons only, most being 1-4 players, "raids" being 6-20. 2 d shops and quest turn-ins+storyline(not as fun as they could be). A decent story nonetheless and great intro but the rest is borish.Free-to-play with a cash shop for good quality of life and a pay-to-win feel. This is one reason players like me don't like F2P models in part of a game's design. Things cost a lot in this game or a lot of time (survey for points bs).... and lag. Lag in this game comes occasionally when interacting in town with inventory or when in dungeons with big groups or laggy hosts. Nexon or devcat for NA is slow to address these issues I guess.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												Best combat of an MMO I have every played, yet (I hope it won't be but it is fun). The main flaw of it's game combat is lack of complete manual aiming, there is a bit of auto-aiming for a number of abilities (they still can miss and sometimes auto-aiming mechanic makes them miss) and some lag and really, really minor issues with control/ui settings. The boss AI is very great, along with the combat. If you are an avid MMO player and want to see great combat mechanics, it's a must try and you can really challenge yourself if it's your goal. The level design of the game is fun and engaging along with the environments, though the scenerio and dungeons maps are very similar.It has great challenges and players can progress through this game the easy route AND they can challenge themselves when dungeons have normal, hard and hero modes and all. It's best to see this game as a co-op, and much better with friends I would assume, though extremely great and fun to solo as well. Also this game gets really "grindy" after levels 50. Leveling and progress becomes slower and more difficult but again if you have dedicated groups it might be more fun then. However, playing this game as a newcomer and about your first month of gameplay will be quite fun for sure if the combat style interests you.Negatives:The game's major design flaws in my mind are what I already mentioned about aiming. Not capitalizing on the jump feature as much (for balancing reason I assume, still good dodge/leap mechanics though) but major ones are. It's not an open world MMO,Expct to be limited to dungeons only, most being 1-4 players, "raids" being 6-20. 2 d shops and quest turn-ins+storyline(not as fun as they could be). A decent story nonetheless and great intro but the rest is borish.Free-to-play with a cash shop for good quality of life and a pay-to-win feel. This is one reason players like me don't like F2P models in part of a game's design. Things cost a lot in this game or a lot of time (survey for points bs).... and lag. Lag in this game comes occasionally when interacting in town with inventory or when in dungeons with big groups or laggy hosts. Nexon or devcat for NA is slow to address these issues I guess.

												Picture an ARPG MMO with instanced combat. Picture that combat is vaguely like Monster Hunter or Dark/Demon's Souls. It really is probably the best combat I've ever seen in a F2P game.Now picture that the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t grind of fighting the same monsters over and over again in hopes of a super-rare drop becomes a mandatory part of progression through the game. And also that each time you want to try a different weapon class, you have to create a new character.I will say it's worth it to experience up through the first main boss, maybe the second. Just expect the grind to become intolerable shortly thereafter.

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												When I found out that Vindictus was by the same guys as Maplestory, I had to try it. Luckily, I was not disappointed. The only problem I have with this game is that it lags when in a party, even at the lowest graphics settings. However, it is only an inconvenience, not a problem. The cutscenes are greatly done, and the story is beautiful. There are plenty of side quests to do, so you don't have to do the main quest immediately. People have complained that you need to grind in order to survive in this, which may be true (I'm not sure), but I enjoy grinding, so it's not a problem for me. All-in-all, I give it 9/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												horrible. the devs were so lazy with the dungeons that you have to play them several times in a row to accomplish some pointless goals. 19 levels in, still stuck running the same boring ice dungeon fighting the exact same enemies with the exact same moves. around this point, the story xp s.h.i.t.s itself and causes the player to have to grind the same dungeon even more to unlock the next story quest (2 levels higher for some f,..u,..c,..k,..e,..d reason). controls are also horrid. the character will usually swing in the direction of the camera which is incredibly stupid, but sometimes they won't. i ended up trying to swing towards some bland kobolds for the millionth time and ended up snapping another direction, hitting a lever, and getting crushed by a spike trap. how in the f,..u,.,..c.,.k can we still not get controls right in this age? hitboxes are almost as bad as dark souls. i can be out of an enemy's swing and get hit. i can be too close for an enemy to hit with their oversized hammers and still get hit. i can be in the middle of a dodge, be under or above a swing, and get hit.on top of all that, there's not a bit of exploration. there's one town and you repeat the same handful of dungeons from the docks. there is an exploration board, but it's a lie. all that is is repeating raid bosses, but buffed tenfold. so, it's pointless and misnamed. garbage. pay to win, too. i got a bunch of free gear with timers that far outclassed everything normally available. speaking of timers, i checked the pay to win store. there's timers on paid items. yes. you pay for temporary items. OR you can spend double to make them permanent. this means, 20 dollars for a permanent outfit, or 10 for it to wear off in a month. how does that make any sense??nexon, by the way. that really explains it all. has nexon made anything not bad?

content:
Posted: September 23, 2012
												Alright, This is a good MMO, I've been playing this since Closed Beta, There are alot of classes and one of the new classes name is Hurk... -----------------------------------------------------------           ~Vindictus Classes~Lann: Lann is a fierce warrior who duel weilds swords. His atttacks are monsterous, Using his abilities to dodge his will not take damage instead he will be immune to the damage for a little amount of time, His second weapons are spears, Spears are a ranged and all out attack but has very little defenseFiona: Fiona is a balanced typed warrior that is equiped with a sword and a shield, Although she is slow sometmes she will hit hard and block off attacks. Her secondary weapon is a hammer that is used for great power Karok/Kalok : Karok is a king fighter that hold a Pillar, He is slow but hits harder, Karok can switch modes into Pillar to Fist. Hist Secondary weapon is a Cestus, Known to be a face-crackling glove that can demolish anything. Karok can clash with most boss making them look like foolsEvie: Evie is a magician type character for those who love to magic, Evie Wield a staff that can summon a golem or heal teammates. Her secondary weapon is a large scythe that is use to cut up monsters in halfs and also used for a special move called "Reverse Gravity"Vella : Vella is a swift warrior that dual wields swords just like a Lann but is much faster, Her points of attack are used to defect monsters or bosses against themselves. Her Secondary weapon are Chain-Blades, Chain-Blades are Blades that can link towards a monster or bring them to you, Vella depends on her skills to attack.Kai: Kai is a archer type character that wields a bow that can switch from Short bow or to Long Bow; Short bow is a attack mode that is used for medium ranged distances and can shoot multiple arrows at onces, Long bow is an attack mode that is used to shoot targets from distances and penetrate through monsters or bosses with a killer attackHurk: Hurk is a geatsword wielder just like Ingkells or Keaghan as you can say. He deals alot of damage from what his weapons can do but his blade does massive splatter, Hurk can backfire bosses attacks and launch enemies into the air, His attack switch up causing some players to be confused. This character is for advanced players.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Gameplay~Vindictus is not your typical Hack and Slasher. This game consist of pain in the♥♥♥♥♥drops but is easy to farm. This game mixes up from Devil May Cry to an MMO base game like Guild Wars (In my opinion) This game can easily be mastered but end-game contents are great, There are alot of battles and things to do like Raid/Farm/PVP... Oh and did I mention PVP? The PVP in this game is great, Siege PVP/Guild PVP/ETC. Siege PVP: Is a counter team PVP mode that takes place into a large castle map seperating both teams.Guild PVP: Is a PVP that you do in a little arena with your powerful guild-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                  |My thoughts|-------------------Overall I give this game a 9/10 to story6/10 To Serversand 10/10 Combat syste,IF you have any questions add me

												Alright, This is a good MMO, I've been playing this since Closed Beta, There are alot of classes and one of the new classes name is Hurk... -----------------------------------------------------------           ~Vindictus Classes~Lann: Lann is a fierce warrior who duel weilds swords. His atttacks are monsterous, Using his abilities to dodge his will not take damage instead he will be immune to the damage for a little amount of time, His second weapons are spears, Spears are a ranged and all out attack but has very little defenseFiona: Fiona is a balanced typed warrior that is equiped with a sword and a shield, Although she is slow sometmes she will hit hard and block off attacks. Her secondary weapon is a hammer that is used for great power Karok/Kalok : Karok is a king fighter that hold a Pillar, He is slow but hits harder, Karok can switch modes into Pillar to Fist. Hist Secondary weapon is a Cestus, Known to be a face-crackling glove that can demolish anything. Karok can clash with most boss making them look like foolsEvie: Evie is a magician type character for those who love to magic, Evie Wield a staff that can summon a golem or heal teammates. Her secondary weapon is a large scythe that is use to cut up monsters in halfs and also used for a special move called "Reverse Gravity"Vella : Vella is a swift warrior that dual wields swords just like a Lann but is much faster, Her points of attack are used to defect monsters or bosses against themselves. Her Secondary weapon are Chain-Blades, Chain-Blades are Blades that can link towards a monster or bring them to you, Vella depends on her skills to attack.Kai: Kai is a archer type character that wields a bow that can switch from Short bow or to Long Bow; Short bow is a attack mode that is used for medium ranged distances and can shoot multiple arrows at onces, Long bow is an attack mode that is used to shoot targets from distances and penetrate through monsters or bosses with a killer attackHurk: Hurk is a geatsword wielder just like Ingkells or Keaghan as you can say. He deals alot of damage from what his weapons can do but his blade does massive splatter, Hurk can backfire bosses attacks and launch enemies into the air, His attack switch up causing some players to be confused. This character is for advanced players.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Gameplay~Vindictus is not your typical Hack and Slasher. This game consist of pain in the♥♥♥♥♥drops but is easy to farm. This game mixes up from Devil May Cry to an MMO base game like Guild Wars (In my opinion) This game can easily be mastered but end-game contents are great, There are alot of battles and things to do like Raid/Farm/PVP... Oh and did I mention PVP? The PVP in this game is great, Siege PVP/Guild PVP/ETC. Siege PVP: Is a counter team PVP mode that takes place into a large castle map seperating both teams.Guild PVP: Is a PVP that you do in a little arena with your powerful guild-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                  |My thoughts|-------------------Overall I give this game a 9/10 to story6/10 To Serversand 10/10 Combat syste,IF you have any questions add me

content:
Posted: September 1, 2012
												I really wanted to like this game but the combat is boring, shallow and repetitive. All classes have few active abilities, resulting in a daunting wall of passives with the occasional counter/contextual skill thrown in instead of engaging actives. Combat revolves around positioning and attack pattern memorization; however, because of the lack of active skills, this boils boss fights down to 20 minute pokefests. Being a Korean MMO, the exp curve gets intense about ¼ of the way up turning the game into a repetitive grindfest of redoing the same dungeons over and over (especially if you're trying to craft because of poor drop rates). Even at the beginning of the game it gets stuck into the typical quest recycling rut forcing you redo areas.Overinstancing, of towns and dungeons, kills immersion & community. Endgame consists of WEEKLY raids. If you have a group to play with this could be fun for a FOTM (or two), but otherwise there are better options for MMOs and Action RPGs elsewhere.

												I've played quite a few Mmorpgs and this one is personally my favorite, I've played is for months now and found little to no flaw in the game itself. It does have a decent story line, good graphics and an all over amazing fightying style. I find the fighting style of this game to be very unique and interesting in my opinion. Most other games do not have the fighting style of this one. You do have to pay for additional things such as more apperance options, weapons, and armor. But it doesn't stop it from being a well made F2P game. And because it is a slasher you do have a game more involved with skill and weapons which i personally enjoy.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												I've come back to this game multiple times and the combat mechanics have always been what I've been talking about in the gaming industry for years.Whether it be TERA Online, D&D Neverwinter, or Vindictus these kinds of games give us more than just massive NUMBER STACKING & pew pew pew shoot'em & guns only games.Naturally I would be more into recommending this game, but comparing this game to others where you are able to go from the beginning and then experience the end game content Vindictus does not really help you do that very well.Not to mention the issues of HOW Vindictus does their free to play market really forces people to either be rich and fork over money OR quit playing all together because I have countless of F2P games and yet THOSE GAMES give you TONS OF FREE GIFTS, even if they do a simple maintenance over bugs, and the gifts they give you HELP they aren't just "oh here's a free hair coupon enjoy!".Vindictus loves to make things over the top, but once you log in to see what you get to use it's usually a HAIR COUPON (7DAYS!!!), some buffs for you skills (7 DAYS!!!), or maybe a exp buff for either the weekend or... (7 DAYS!!!!!!!!)It really gets rather old that god FORBID they actually give you rewards & gifts that are actually AMAZING or at least greater than time sensitive items.Not everyone can HANDCUFF THEMSELVES TO THEIR COMPUTER/CONSOLES for the entire time they have these lousy TIME SENSITIVE ITEMS!More to the point of playability, free to play has to do with how you get those gamers that AREN'T playing or logged on to come back and see what they have in store for them when they log back in to play.Don't just damage the community with horribly done F2P marketing schemes & make it much more enjoyable for ALL PLAYERS, ANYONE to jump into the fray and collect that end game content!!The more players you shut out from the end game content the more player base you lose because the game itself is about what EVERYONE is able to do in the game, not just the people who give you a quick buck or those players who have no life by playing non-stop.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2013
												Edit #3: This is part is mostly to get that sweet fall sale 2016 badge but the new updates do make this game more friendly torwards casual players so that's a thing now.Edit #2: I was looking at a lot of the reviews and noticed people are saying this game is pay2win. That             is not the case. It is pay2beconvenient. It is possible to get good gear without spending money, it will just be harder. With the recent season 3 update (recent as in today), it is no longer a problem to get decent stats to do raids with. You can now literally get your gear by playing the raids and using the seals you get as a 100% drop for the materials you need for your gear. Nexon has been a horrendous company in the past, but I think that as of recently they have made a change for the better. I highly suggest anyone who has quit the game for these reasons to give it another chance.Edit: 2000+ hours and it's still pretty good.I have played 1000+ hours of this game so they must be doing something right.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
												I played  more than enough (around 2010 i believe) and i think it's about time people knows what this game really is about. Here's a summary: You'll play till lvl 70 and realise how EXPENSIVE and how much you need to GRIND in order to get some decent stuff. Basically, you'll either end up multi-accounting or botting due to the fact that the dungeons are limited/day and some /weeks. Otherwise, if you have that "collect errything" or "i want my avatar to look unique!!" syndrome, stay FAR away from this game because i swear it will destroy your wallet's an*s and will take HUNDREDS of dollars from you. If you don't have that but you like being powerful and you are an overachiever kind of player that likes to max out everything and get the best stuff possible, get ready to spend money too because this game >> (-that's where the real bulls**t begins-)<< has a SH1*TY SYSTEM when it comes to "enhance (+up)" or "enchant (add scrolls to your gear)".First BS fact: so, when you enhance (max in the game is +15) you'll need potions and stones, this is the alrighty broly part but when you reach a certain point (+10 i do believe) your gear gets "binded" that means you can't sell it anymore BUT you can buy unbind potions and you can unbind 3 times, after that you're f00ckt. When you enchant over +10, you have higher chances to break your weapon and when you break it you'll have to pay in AP (attribute points i think). These are the points you use to upgrade skills and since they added that "repair broken weapons with AP" system they also introduced their "AP capsule pack" and when you enhance or enchant you can buy runes that whenever you fail your rune breaks instead of your weapon but since +15 is pretty much impossible without buying from the item shop you'll end up spending around 150$ (if you're very lucky) of runes.Second BS fact: in this game you can also colour your gear. Now that is probably the most fked up part IMO, if you want your gear white or pink (or any freaking nice colour you want) you'll pay over millions for some stupid 4ss dyes that you buy from the shop... Or, you can content yourself with the dark and sh**ty colours you'll pay to dye from dye shop. When you buy some dyes you'll have this little thing. . . Look this video and you'll notice the BS involved >:( 


YouTube™ Video: Vindictus: Clodagh's Dye Ampoule 

			Views: 9,792		

			Just showing what these dye ampoule's do exactly :)		

So yeah, you pick your colour (If you manage to) and then you hope to get dat one out of six colour that you picked. Every F*ING G*DDAMN thing in this game is about a RGN system, EVERYTHING is built up to suck your wallet's J*zzThird BS fact: The servers, they suck so much! Whenever an event begins (they are all focused on that stupid avatar shop btw) the servers are impossible to deal with, everything lags so much you keep crashing and failing your dungeons you spent half an hour doing so you'll have to wait for that to end before doing them and this, is since they released their sh*tty game.Fourth BS fact: The support, i lost millions of gold in items sending them through mail to put them on another character (because this game likes to swarm you with useless garbage to force you to buy their item slots) and i contacted them and they told me "oh well we can't do jack-sh*t for you unfortunately, soooo yeah HAVE A GOOD DAY :D" my reaction followed with a(凸ಠ益ಠ)凸 and then i heard lots and lots of people ranting on it saying how slow and lazy they are.Fifth BS fact: I suffer from dat "It's rare? It's mine!" syndrom and sometimes they put a "limited time item/outfit" and im like "i'll buy it" and one year later that same thing pops back up again...All in all, this game would be so enjoyable if it was open world and if it didn't had that pay to play and pay to win GARBAGE SYSTEM. I met a lot of great people in it (sometimes some lame-4ss t4rds) heard some strange sometimes some sad stories and enjoyed playing with those people but everything is broke up with all this puke everywhere and then there's this r*t4rded server rivality and that could've been a good occasion to place a World VS World system but im affraid they'll make you pay for a fklng pass to try it out!If you don't believe in this review, go find out for yourself but just do me a favor and avoid giving this fked up company more money than they deserve. They make EA look like an angel next to them.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
												Viva Kebabs- 546 Flinders Street, Melbourne.After seeing many reviews praising Viva Kebabs, I thought it would be best to try a HSP from there for myself so here's my review. (I got a lamb HSP with cheese and the holy trinity)Signage: 10/10. The Halal certification was on the front of the store. A bit small but noticeable enough. There were neon lights on the side which were still fairly noticeable during the day.Greeting: 10/10. As usual, Viva Kebabs is pretty busy but the guys there are nice. Don't remember the exact words but I remember hearing 'brother' which is always welcoming.Packaging: Styro/10.Chips: 10/10. They were cooked fresh, nice and crispy with a slight crunch. Defs worth the wait.Sauce: 10/10. The amount of sauce was very generous, some even dripped onto the floor. I forgot what other sauce went on the holy trinity besides barbecue and garlic (Blanked out lmao) but the guy knew what I wanted straight away.Cheese: 10/10. A good amount of cheese that melted with the heat of the meat. The cheese was covered in sauce as well so it didn't taste plain.Meat: 10/10. A great ratio between the meat and chip serving size. The meat didn't taste bland at all, my tastebuds must have jumped with joy when they experienced the taste of the overall HSP. The meat was stacked like a mountain, heaps of meat there.Price: 9/10. It was $15 which is a fair price considering the top notch quality, and you get to choose a drink.Overall rating: A solid 10/10. Everything is cooked fresh and tastes splendid. The serving size is pretty big, I struggled to finish it by myself so it'll definitely fill you up. It's pretty easy to access as well as its roughly halfway between Flinders street station and southern cross. The only bad thing is that there aren't any seats nearby but that doesn't really matter.Would 10/10 recommend trying Viva Kebabs if you haven't already.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2012
												A very solid MMO. The game is purely action based, and is very fun. Attacks do not rely on a formula to hit, like WoW, and every click of the attack button has an instant response. It's a but simple, but the battles are very satisfying.   The game looks great, and uses the Source engine to its fullest. Bosses are large and well detailed. Environments are small, but there is a lot of detail in them as well. There are a few texture issues here and there, but the game looks nice overall.   The voice acting is sparce, at most. It mostly consists of grunts from your character and the few voiced cutscenes. The soundtrack is great, with each dungeon having their own themes. Boss themes are truly epic.  The cash shop only has cosmetics, EXP/AP boosters and the standard enchantment insurance scrolls. Nothing that is required in any way to enjoy the game. Sure, the game gets grindy, but the EXP rate is pretty fair. Each mission has its own boss, so it rarely gets dull. Definitely worth it.

												Lackluster controls and gameplay.  Weird world design, very restricted, seems to require public matchmade parties to do anything, even if no one is available to join. number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												I wish that people would post useful reviews instead of unfunny one-liners that help no one.In terms of graphics, this game is all right, nothing ground breaking but areas are bright, vibrant and overall good looking.The music is -okay- nothing memorable, however it isn't bad, it's good.The gameplay/controls are quick and responsive, and easy to learn, not overly complicated like some MMOs out today and that's a plus for me, as most mmos/games have you sifting through tons of menus to do everything. Not here.Character customization is good, you can pretty much customise it however you want. Towns and outside areas are pretty lively  and bright and interesting to look at. The game is fun and easy to get into for new players and it isn't pay to win too much if you don't mind grinding countless hours for equipment. The providor, however, Nexon, is notoriously bad and is at the bottom of the barrel in customer service. Its taken ages for me to get respomnses from them in any way, shape or form, so counting on them is a nope. So there's your warning on that before you consider this game.All in all this game has everything you'd expect from a F2P game, its AVERAGE. Nothing incredibly mind blowing. Its not incredible, but it isn't bad either, so I can't NOT reccomend it. If you want a game with fun sword/pillar?/club/whatever gameplay, and interesting combat, then yes, try it out. But if you're looking for great customer service. Then nope. I am on the fence about this one, really.Before any of you say "You have only 4 hours on record what do you know" I played it through the Nexon site before it went to Steam. So nope.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												Alright, I was pretty pumped to play something new and original in the MMO space. But I gotta say, for being new and original... this game is pretty boring. Maybe I didn't give it enough time, but I don't necessarily think that's my fault. Here's why.1) The intro story sets up nothing for a new player. There's a giant spider attacking a tower. Why is this relevant to me? I can't connect with this chick who's mysteriously talking to giant spiders... And maybe I could get a little narrative on why this village chose a giant spider as its guardian anyways?? There's just too much left out, but what's worse, I'm not compelled to want to learn why. I'm compelled to♥♥♥♥♥blast some gnolls with my tree, and that's it.And then there I was, clicking with no real danger to me. Nothing had hit me, or even come close. I even did the first few missions, thinking okay, I get the basic controls, let's get into something challenging... but no. I got to the gnoll boss in the second mission and realized I was thinking about how much fun I'd have playing something else. And maybe it could have been better if I was playing with other people, but there was just no one. I sat on the boat throwing dice for 5 full minutes waiting for someone to join my group, and it was only when i was 90% through the dungeon did someone join my group. Now, I will say this game has absolutely BEAUTIFUL graphics, some of the armor i saw on other players was just really cool looking, same with some of the weapons. And character creation was surprisingly robust for a F2P game with paid cosmetic options. But I feel like this game focuses too much on how cool everything looks, and forgets that gameplay needs to be fun, too.

												Honestly, if you could click a single button and skip all the pointless dialogue, I'd recommend it.
