content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												This game gave me cancer so instead I'll tell you the 10 easy steps you can take to making a traditional tiramisu at home! Ingredients3 large eggs500 grams [~12.3 oz.] Mascarpone cheeseEspresso or Strong CoffeeBoudoir biscuits/ Lady fingers/ thin cakes(optional) 1 cup of cognacPowdered cocoa [or instant chocolate drink mix]Sugar (to taste)STEP 1 : Crack and make 3 large eggs into two different bowls (use a large bowl for the egg white and a smaller bowl for the yolk). Make sure that none of the yolk gets mixed with the egg white, otherwise the egg whites won't whisk properly.STEP 2 : Whisk the egg yolks with an electronic whisk and gradually add sugar until the egg yolk becomes thick, creamy, and light yellow.STEP 3 : Add about 5oo grams [~12.3 oz.] of Mascarpone in another bowl and give it a quick stir to loosen it up. Then, with the electronic whisk, mix the egg yolks and Mascarpone together.STEP 4 : Wash and dry your whisk and then whisk the egg whites until they form firm peaks. Continue to fold the egg whites into the Mascarpone and mix until there are no lumps.STEP 5 : Put that to the side. Make some strong espresso and let it cool.STEP 6 : Line a large and fairly deep dish with lady fingers (boudoir biscuits) and pour over two thirds of the coffee mixture.STEP 7 : Put half of your egg mixture over the top of that, followed by a thick dusting of cocoa. Use an instant drinking chocolate, as it's a little sweeter.STEP 8 : Dip more lady fingers into the rest of your coffee mix (don't worry if you run out; you can just knock up some more) and carefully place them over the the top of the cocoa.STEP 9 : Empty the rest of your egg mixture over that and dust with cocoa again.STEP 10 : Leave it in your refrigerator for two hours and serve.Now take the tiramisu out of the fridge and stuff it all into your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, wait 3-4 days for results.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2012
												A nice blend of hack-n-slash and MMO. It's alright if you play with friend(s), but if you go solo, this game might last you 30 min. As with any H-N-S, the fighting is repetitive with your attacks being the same and the baddies being the same. Prepare to fight the spider mob reskinned about 8 times. F2P makes up for a lot of this, though it also suffers "pay2win" with auto-party res(surection) for sale for real cash and gear that makes you Norris-like. Prostitution has gone digital as you can purchase thongs and string bikini tops for your toons for a whopping $20! The story is very good and is perhaps the game's strongest pro. The beef that I have with the game is I feel like content is deliberately withheld from me JUST so they can charge me for it, instead of additional content for sale. 6/10 Best played as a break from your main games and only in small bursts. It's not awful but not that great either.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												Vindictus is one of those MMO's that you can't miss out on. It has fantastic graphics, characters, environments, and more. In this review I will be breaking down the good parts, and the bad parts in category. Good:Gameplay:  Vindictus uses traditional real-time combat that is both fun, and hilarious. Each level has a multitude of scattered object that the player can pick up and use as a weapon. From pots, to enemies corpses there's hardly anything that your character cannot use. Because of this, you will have many hilarious moments when whacking a boss with a cleaning broom. After the final blow to every boss, you go into slowmotion, where you can see your character in the act for some extremely amazing screenshots. Graphics: The in-game graphics are some of the best to date. When on the highest possible graphics, the environments, characters and enemies are stunning and feel real, despite the fantasy world it takes place in.Storyline & Lore: I'll be perfectly honest, the games storyline isn't very intriging. The game takes place in it's own universe with diverse, and utterly odd creatures and dietys. The game features so many sub-plots to the point that the main storyline isn't really important, and is optional. The game is not voiced over, instead upon speaking to say a quest giver, you will see a picture of them, and have text only dialoge. Trust me, you do NOT need ANY storyline to get sucked into the game.Community: The game's player size is pretty healthy. From levels 1-80. Despite the healthy size, it is not neccessarily a friendly one. There are few ways to really interact with other players. The guild systems are simple, basic, and do absolutely nothing. The chat system is decent. Most players do not interact with one another, this is more of a "help yourself" type of community.Overall,Good:*Amazing Graphics*Great, fun, and interesting gameplay mechanics*Great in-game economy*Great variety of maps, dungeons, and HUBS*Relitively healthy player base*Amazing musical scoresBad: *Unfriendly community and playerbase*Borderline "Pay-2-Win"*FREQUENT crashes ( server based )*Extremely hard to run on any computer*Lack of variety in missionsVerdict: 8/10 NOTES: Only play this if you have a relitively healthy and powerful PC. I have frequent crashing on a fairly new system. God Bless,-TheFurryFox

												This was a very interesting and enjoyable romp, the story line was nice and I liked the event items I received when I started to play. The customizing was okay and although I'm not fond of having to purchase certain types of things in the cash shop I figured it was typical of this developer and moved on.I did have a few somewhat annoying issues, which is where to purchase better gear for my avatar. The gear I found was okay, but not as good or powerful as I expected as I leveled. The shops and crafting was a bit confusing & asking for help didn't always spawn a helpful reply. Finding companions to game with wasn't simple either, nor was finding parties to do specific quests. But it was fairly entertaining and fun which is what it's supposed to offer, so in that area it succeeded.

												I read several reviews before I downloaded this game, and even though several of them were bad reviews, i decided to download anyway. Then I made a Nexon account and started playing. Three things stood out to me: One, the game was ok, the startout was fine and te character creation was pretty good. Two, lag like hell. I have a pretty nice computer, and I don't get lag in very many situations no matter what I'm playing, but this was just crappy server lag. Three, BUGS I read a review by some guy that said if some other company took over this game instead of Nexon that it would end up a lot better. From what I've seen, this is true. When I play the game, even if I turn it on highest volume, I get NO sound. None. I've seen several other bugs as well that just screw the game over for me. But to top it all off, half the time I can't even play simply cause the log in box shows an error message and won't let me log in. Until Nexon gets their♥♥♥♥♥♥together, don't bother downloading.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 27, 2014
												The biggest selling point for me was the combat system. Surprisingly has lots of depth and plenty of bosses to test your metal. Best description I can give it is if Monster Hunter and Dynasty Warriors had a really glitchy and laggy baby. Games are player hosted in 4 man parties, these parties can go to 8 man raids for bigger boss fights which is difficult to host for many without a higher tier bandwidth connection. Game also has some server issues in general. Game would be perfect if not for the mentioned problems.Combat is sweet, presentation is superb, and game is actually translated into proper english!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 24, 2013
												If you’re looking a hard-core boss fights, this may be the game for you. Since recent patches “Jan 2014” to the game, levelling has never been so easy! Doing the main quest and little bit of side quest will get you max in no time. Story is very good if you bother to follow, but where this game really shows its true colours, 'is the boss fights' with intensive, hard, proactive game mechanics you find yourself trying to defeat this boss over and over. But once you think you have mastered this boss fight you fail to dodge his attack and fall over and die.

												Surprisingly good!Solid gameplay/combat (starts far too easy but gets challenging later)The downsides are that you have to click through a lot of bad dialogue if you want to do the quests properly. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
												in a vague base point the combat is amazing and fun, there is a good story if you take the time to read the dialouges but that can be quite tedious to some people, if you ever played mabinogi this is pre-mabi, as in the dark war ages, the games dungeon system feels really nice and unuiqe untill you find you're self grinding dungeons over and over and over Post-Lvl 60, some people say its hard to level but honestly getting to 60 with out spending a dime on xp boosters is quite easy, 70 is actually pretty easy to with the addition of twilight desert farms, Classes/Characters: Great options there is bound to be some thing for every one. 9/10 ( Sword or Hammer w/Shield Class, Dual Swords / Dual Spears Class, Dual Swords / Chain Blades Class, Staff / Scythe Class, Pillar / Guantlet Class, Giant Sword Class, Bow / Crossgun Class )Graphics: Amazing graphics and Bloody Combat 10/10Story: the story is quite good but the delivery is easily ignored and poorly presented 6/10Combat: Action and Combo Style combat with lots of control 10/10Pre-Lv40 Grind: Extremely LowPost-Lv40 Grind: LightPost-Lv60 Grind: MediumGrinding can feel quite different for lots of people but to my experiences from flyff back in the day and games like runescape or some of the perfect world series, vindictus grind is quite low and balanced imo 8/10, some might feel other wise,Cash Shop: Needed for hairstyles, Inner Armors, Extended Inv, and high end weapon Enchanting / Enhancing , as well as quite addicting to some people and can cause quite the cash spend , 6/10

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												Nyeah... I REALLY REALLY wanted to love this game. And, maybe if I had played it two months back I'd have enjoyed it more. The character/ weapon designs are just fantastic. The trailors for it made me cream my panties... but...recently I got into Raiderz... it's not nearly as pretty as Vindictus, but the fights...  they're just not as fun. This game feels very hack n slash compaired to Raiderz...  Where as in Raiderz fights feel like actual fights, requiring split second decisions. You have to anticipate your enemies attacks and know when to go in for the kill... Rushing will just get you dead dead dead...  I'd hope to have a similar experience in Vindictus... but after two hours I was bored and disapointed... Also was very annoyed by the game's interface, and dialog was very final fantasy-ish. I'd recommend Vindictus to someone who wants a pretty and modern looking MMO that is unique. But the level of indepth combat just wasn't what I was expecting or hoping for. Zerks from raiders would like Vindictus... They're very "hur hur slashy slashy."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 15, 2012
												Loved it  up until I hit the level cap.  The game itself is genius, calling it a "unique" MMO conparing to all other MMO's out there. It's a Third Person Dungeon Runner with beautiful graphics if your card can handle it, great game to play with friends, and on a brighter side, It's flippin' free to play.  Now to get technical, there is however some flaws like in most MMO's. In Vindictus you won't find yourself adventuring around so much. In fact, you'll be running around the same dungeons over and over again until you reach certain requirements to pass on to the next. There really is no questing besides the ones you pick up in the two cities. The  classes are gender blocked, meaning each class is a specific gender. But on the flip side its fast, fun, easy to play and a great game to waste some time with. I'd give it a hard 8/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 12, 2012
												One of the best renditions of Third Person point-and-click combat available. Combining elements of Monster Hunter combat and an MMORPG environment. Combat is entirely controlled by the user including controls for movement, dodging, aim (what little there is for a hack and slash), and mouse-button skills.A perfect combination of Valve Engine's physics enable environmental destruction and being able to pick up and use any object as a weapon.The one downside to the game is the rather repetitive battles in-lieu of Monster Hunter. Characters set up a battle by the Docks and are loaded onto a boat before leaving with your party. Battles are linear and very enclosed with monsters spawning all the way to the boss.Overall, the game is a great play.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 9, 2012
												Hack Slash and CRASH!The game is simply beautiful (on max settings). It has taken the MMORPG genre, and put a v8 twin turbo 1,200HP engine right under the hood and thrown the gear into overdrive. It's fun, it's emersive, it's just something outrageously different. Even though F2P mmo's are out there, and everyone is trying to find a new one to play every couple weeks because you get tired of the grind fest, this one is fun and keeps you playing the whole time.The story? It's alright; but you really play for the fun of playing with other players and killing everything you can with extremely strong and seemingly appropriate gear. And guess what? The girls in this game actually have appropriate gear for higher teirs that cover up their body and protect them properly. The mage still has revealing clothes, like she does throughout the whole game, but she is still more protected at the endgame.The annoying part is the endless grindfest from lvl's 60-80. It's is monotoneous and never seems to end. But is is fun when you have friends to do it with. You will have fun, and you will enjoy the game.It's not so much "P2W (Pay to win)" as you might think. You can get extremely great endgame gear and you can make the gear if you want. The difficulty of doing so is very high, but the payoff is great and it is possible to have great equipment when you're at lvl 80.So have fun, go shoot monsters in the face with magic bolts and arrows, or killing them with a heaping heck of a huge sword, or maybe hack and slash 'em with your double swords, or lances, or just punch them in the face until they die a brutal, uncomfortable death. TENOUTTATEN

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
												Vindictus is a game that hasn't seen a lot of popularity, but it doesn't mean it is terrible.The Action combat in Vindictus is TRUE action combat.The levels feel difficult to complete on your own, but that adds to the action.Combo's in Vindictus are very fluid and easy to execute, and just feel very nice overall.There are a total of nine different characters with their own unique weapons.The classes are Gender-locked, but they do have great customization (if you want to pay real money for it.)Each class is unique in their own way. Arisha is a mix of Magic and Swordsman ship. Being able to cast spells and enchant her sword with Arcane Energy to do a lot of damage.Hurk is just an berserker. He does insane amounts of damage in as little time as possible.Evie is the traditional "mage" of the game. Using her staff OR a scythe, she is able to attack from ranged with devastating magic spells.Kai is an archer. I think that says enough.Overall, Vindictus is a very good game and I HIGHLY reccommend it!

The player models are also well done and very customizable, however that is where the great parts end.Expect to grind the same levels over and over, usually gaining little experiance or key loot along the way and trading in everything for the next gear set. After getting mid to high range, expect to get hacked as this game is very suseptible to both in game player hackers and people stealing accounts, even when you utilize a 16 digit random password. 												This game to be short is a great game at first. Let me explain. This game an i had a great connection, i would play it and i would get coupons for things you usually had to pay for. I would play this game for a long period of time and it would reward me with more coupons, and this would keep me playing. Even when i would log off for a year and a half i came back to the game giving me a crap load of skill points (which i instantly through away). After that the game would give me Permanant stuff. like hair coupons, underwear coupons, etc I took it as a reward for playing for so long. After this i played for about 50 more hours i got off for another half year. Upon arriving back to vindictus. it told me that i had gotten nothing new, which i found odd. usually it would give me atleast one thing like a new coupon or weapon set. but no, it came out to be that it game me a box that i got 1 potion for the long wait. i said "meh" and carried on. going into a high level dungen i noticed then I HAD NO WEAPONS NOR ARMOR, this was infuriating! seeing as though the game game me "permanant" weapons. i had to abort the mission where then i came back to town, looking for any kind of weapon i could use. i found the market place and found that all weapons my level were selling for 3 quarters of a million coin ( i obviously dont have this kind of money) so i then wonder around the map trying to find litteraly anything i could use. i stummble in the forge and buy a staff for really cheap. i say sweet and go back into the mission i needed to do. when i arrive at the mission i find myself not able to do any kind of damage to the things i need to fight which it takes me about 30 minutes to do a normal level. i figure "why not go to a lower level to get money so i can buy a staff my level" i then find out that there are level penaltys for level diffrence frome a missions level to my level which give me 0 coin. this also makes me mad seeing as though im stuck to where i am till nexon gives me another "permanent" weapon.in short:Pros:*Story*Gameplay*Multiplayer*Rewarding*Fun to Play CharactersCons:*It's Made by Nexon

The selection of Characters mixed with their abilities and how each has thei own strengths and downfalls, the sheer action of the game as well will have you sitting there enthralled it this brilliant Masterpiece. Sure, it has it's flaws and some Minor Connection issues here and there. But over all this Game is a Most Have in my oppinion. I'd Wake up and I'd Enter the Lobby and wait there until the Proper number of people joined and we'd hunt ourselves a Dragon!Yes, this game is amazingly addicting and fun. No, it is not a flawless game, no game is and every game has there flaws or small Blemishes here and there. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
Product received for free
												Well, it's hard to say for sure, but I do like the combat, and many things in the environment can be used as weapons. Destructable landscape is a nice touch, so is being able to pick up a recently slain enemy's corpse and beating another enemy with it. Extremely gratifying to the raging sociopath in us all. ;)The quest system...well..it could use some improvment. An empty room/building screen with some thumbnails of NPCs gives you a quest. If you pick the right NPC. Not game-breaking, but a little awkward in my opinion, and the journal system seems lacking.The skill system seems a little confusing. For example, there is no obvious way to undo points once you've alotted them. I actually buggered up an early quest that was supposed to teach me how to use the skill system because I inadvertantly put the points into the wrong skill, and could find no way to undo it. So now I can't seem to advance past that quest, short of going out and grinding out some more kills to get more points. However that doesn't seem terribly easy to do, at least as a solo player, since as near as I can tell, everything is instanced. I could be wrong about that, since I got terribly frustrated with that scenario and logged off. I will go back and look into that, and if I am wrong I will change my review accordingly.  Failing that I may start over, and try again.  Simply because the combat is worth a second chance, despite my own ineptitude.Overall my first impression is that it is a decent game, with extremely fun and visceral combat. I would like to see more character customization,(that isn't hidden behind a microtrans) but that is a complaint in many, many games for me; microtransactions or not.  I have always disliked age and gender-locks, but it is an action game with RPG elements, not a straight-up RPG.  Gender-lock bothers me more in RPGs, as some games go overboard with 'sexy girls with ridiculous physics and sloot-boots'. I want a female warrior, not a pole-dancer.But anyway, I digress, as I am wont to do. Yes, I would recommend this game if only for the great combat. Perhaps it would be more enjoyable if I weren't a die-hard soloer, but it is not a bad game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Product received for free
												Okay, I will say right now vindictus is NOT FOR EVERYBODY. Pros:-Competent combat system. Each character gets 2 to 3 weapon types to choose from which greatly alters combat. with fun souls styled combat.-Graphics. For a source game it looks pretty damn good.-Dungeons. They're fun and well designed.-Generous devs (At times). You are often awarded cash shop stuff for free such as the vvip service.Cons:-Grind city. Levels 1-60 are a chore and leveling speed varies at times from decently paced to agonizingly slow.-Forced to re-run dungeons early game to advance. Gotta meet the next dungeons level requirement.-Long party waiting time. Bring friends.-Awful story. I personally cant be bothered to pay any attention to it. The story is awful.(This is my subjective opinion)Final thoughts: Vindictus is a good game riddled with some minor flaws. I recommend it to anybody willing to spend 60+ hours to get to the meat of the game. Raid bosses are neat. And it has a decent virtual economy.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												MMORPGs are usually pretty boring in terms of combat. Even TERA gets kind of old.But holy♥♥♥♥♥♥ this game. The combat makes TERA's combat look like last years child's play. Each class has unique and jaw dropping skills in their arsenal to bring to the battle. None of the classes are boring, except for maybe Fiona. Oh, and also their gender locked, which might bother some, but I don't mind. As good as the combat is, the way the game is structured is not as great. Dungeon crawling constantly is pretty cool, but if this was a game in an open world that would've been crazy good. I would've been thoroughly impressed. But nothing's perfect.So in conclusion, if you're itching for some hardcore fighting, come try out Vindictus. This game beats any game I've ever played in terms of combat. I am so genuinely content each time I come back to this game, only because of the sick♥♥♥♥♥♥you get to pull in a fight. The only reason I'd say this game is bad is that it isn't open world, and it's Nexon.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
												Vindictus is a game that hasn't seen a lot of popularity, but it doesn't mean it is terrible.The Action combat in Vindictus is TRUE action combat.The levels feel difficult to complete on your own, but that adds to the action.Combo's in Vindictus are very fluid and easy to execute, and just feel very nice overall.There are a total of nine different characters with their own unique weapons.The classes are Gender-locked, but they do have great customization (if you want to pay real money for it.)Each class is unique in their own way. Arisha is a mix of Magic and Swordsman ship. Being able to cast spells and enchant her sword with Arcane Energy to do a lot of damage.Hurk is just an berserker. He does insane amounts of damage in as little time as possible.Evie is the traditional "mage" of the game. Using her staff OR a scythe, she is able to attack from ranged with devastating magic spells.Kai is an archer. I think that says enough.Overall, Vindictus is a very good game and I HIGHLY reccommend it!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
												Ok, im gonna start by saying this game is NOT perfect.  Nexon makes it SO hard to get gold and A LOT of the items in the cash shop is rather expensive.  But, this game is rather fun.  combat is really smooth depending on the character you play.  Maps are a bit over used, you will be playing the same quest over and over, just to get gold on some useless items.  Music is AMAZING, BUT THEY DON'T USE IT!!!  Thats probably my biggest complaint, the music in this game is probably some of my favorite type of music.  The quests are rather dull especially since they dont have music.  The story is decent for an MMO, but I only read the first and last chapter.  Im still going to be playing through it again and read through the whole thing.  If you want a pretty fun MMO, play this, its free.  Just don't spend any money on this if you are just going to play it once.  It also a lot better with friends to talk to while playing since it can be boring on the season 2 quests since they are a bit more open.*edit*I feel its about time I edit my review, with 200 hours under my belt now, I still feel the same.  Season 2 quests are a bit more fun now playing with randoms, but can get frustrating when the host has ♥♥♥♥♥♥ internet.  Most of the grinding once you reach level 60 starts taking way to long.  You rarley ever level up, but like I said up above if you have friends that grinding isn't going to be as boring.  You are going to want to craft most of your own armor once you reach high levels since most of the time the marketplace gets overly expensive when trying to buy equipment.  If you happen to find yourself on the West Vindictus server, come and join me and my friend's guild Sekai.  We are rather small, but we are willing to take on more active players.
